channel.title: News on Pavel Iosad
channel.description: Recent content in News on Pavel Iosad

item.title: Teaching in spring term 2021
item.description: In Semester 2 of 2020⁄2021, I am course organizer for the pre-Honours course LEL2D: Cross-Linguistic Variation: Limits and Theories, where I also teach the universals of variation and phonology blocks. I also teach in pre-Honours on Linguistics and the Gaelic Language, and at Honours/MSc level on Historical Linguistics and Guided Research in Linguistics and English Language.

item.title: Glossa paper
item.description: My paper with Will Lamb entitled Dialect variation in Scottish Gaelic nominal morphology: A quantitative study has appeared in Glossa: A Journal of General Linguistics.

item.title: Frlsu Published
item.description: My paper The life cycle of preaspiration in the Gaelic languages has appeared in the Proceedings of the 2018 Forum for Research on the Languages of Scotland and Ulster.

item.title: Zvegincev
item.description: I gave talk on my ongoing project on northern European areal phonology at the 2020 Zvegintsev Conference to celebrate 60 years of my alma mater, OTiPL.

item.title: Abralin
item.description: I gave a talk with an overview of some of my recent work on Russian phonology for the Abralin ao Vivo series of online talks.

item.title: Vaplujub
item.description: I have contributed a brief paper on Russian yer vowels to a Festschrift for my undergraduate supervisor, Vladimir Plungian.

item.title: Sem1 Start
item.description: In Semester 1 of 2020⁄2021, I am teaching on Linguistics and English Language 1A, where I am responsible for the data analysis block, and on Phonological Theory. I am also offering a Guided Research in LEL seminar entitled What’s Where When Why: Linguistic diversity, typology, and historical linguistics

item.title: Rhema Paper
item.description: My paper on the e ~ ’o alternation in Russian in Stratal Phonology (in Russian) has appeared in Rhema.

item.title: Sem2 Start
item.description: In Semester 2 of 2019⁄2020, I am course organizer for the pre-Honours course LEL2D: Cross-Linguistic Variation: Limits and Theories, where I also teach the phonology block. I also teach in pre-Honours on LEL2E: Structure and History of European Languages and on Linguistics and the Gaelic Language, and at Honours/MSc level on Historical Phonology and Current Issues in Phonology.

item.title: Eshp4
item.description: I presented a poster entitled Drift revisited: Phonological convergence in northern Europe at the Fourth Edinburgh Symposium on Historical Phonology.

item.title: Gjert Kristoffersen Fs
item.description: I have contributed a paper on Norwegian preaspiration to a Festschrift for Gjert Kristoffersen.

item.title: Promotion
item.description: I have been promoted to Senior Lecturer.

item.title: Summer Uploads
item.description: I have uploaded two draft manuscripts, one on the history of preaspiration in the Gaelic languages and another on the phonology of Welsh calediad and what it can tell us about feature theory. Comments are, as usual, welcome.

item.title: Autumn Teaching
item.description: In Semester 1 of 2019⁄2020, I am course organizer for the Honours courses Phonological Theory and Language Contact and the History of English. I also teach in pre-Honours on Linguistics and English Language 1A.

item.title: 2019 Spring Talks
item.description: In the spring semester of 2018⁄2019, I presented invited talks at the Languages and Literatures Research Seminar at the University of Stirling, at the Linguistics Seminar at University College London, at Newcastle University (with Warren Maguire) and at Formal Approaches to Russian Linguistics 3 at Moscow State University.

item.title: 2019 Spring Teaching
item.description: In Semester 2 of 2018⁄2019, I am course organizer for the pre-Honours course LEL2D: Cross-Linguistic Variation: Limits and Theories, where I also teach the phonology block. I also teach in pre-Honours on LEL2E: Structure and History of European Languages and on Linguistics and the Gaelic Language, and at Honours/MSc level on Historical Phonology.

item.title: OUP Proposal
item.description: Oxford University Press has accepted the proposal for a volume I will co-edit with Björn Köhnlein (The Ohio State University), provisionally entitled Synchronic and diachronic approaches to tonal accent, for the Oxford Studies in Phonology and Phonetics series.

item.title: Manchester talk
item.description: I gave a talk at the University of Manchester entitled Evidence for Stratal Phonology: Stem-level phonology and morphological structure. The slides and handout are available here

item.title: Teaching
item.description: In Semester 1 of 2018⁄2019, I am teaching Honours/MSc courses in Phonological Theory, Celtic Linguistics, and run the data analysis component of Linguistics and English Language 1A. My guidance and feedback hour this semester is 13:00–15:00 on Thursdays.

item.title: Talks
item.description: I presented A metrical analysis of Scottish Gaelic tonal accent (Rannsachadh na Gàidhlig 2018), and (co-authored with Warren Maguire) English epenthesis in lC and rC clusters: Areal effect or drift? (ICEHL XX)

item.title: Frlsu Presentation
item.description: I presented The Norse influence on Scottish Gaelic, 85 years on at the 12th conference of the Forum for Research on the Languages of Scotland and Ulster. Get the slides and handout here

item.title: History of Phonology
item.description: I have a uploaded a revised draft of my paper on phonology in the Soviet Union for the forthcoming Oxford History of Phonology. Comments welcome!

item.title: Vja
item.description: As of July 2018, I will serve as a member of the editorial board at Russia’s premier linguistics journal, Voprosy jazykoznanija

item.title: Frlsu
item.description: I will present The influence of Norse on Scottish Gaelic, 85 years on at the 12th conference of the Forum for Research on the Languages of Scotland and Ulster.

item.title: 26mfm
item.description: I presented There is no problem of /v/ in Russian phonology at the 26th Manchester Phonology Meeting. Get the slides and handout here

item.title: Aaz
item.description: An obituary of the great Russian linguist Andrei Zaliznyak that I co-wrote with Maria Koptjevskaja-Tamm, Dmitri Sitchinava, and Alexander Piperski has appeared in Linguistic Typology. Read it in open access here.

item.title: Fgls
item.description: I presented Norwegian preaspiration in traditional and modern sources at the 13th Forum for Germanic Language Studies.

item.title: ot handbook
item.description: My chapter on Optimality Theory has appeared in the Routledge handbook of phonological theory (edited by S. J. Hannahs and Anna Bosch). Download the draft here

item.title: Teaching
item.description: In the second semester of 2017⁄2018, I am teaching Historical Phonology (Honours/MSc), Current Issues in Phonology (Honours/MSc), LEL2D: Cross-Linguistic Variation: Limits and Theories (pre-Honours; I am also the course organizer), LEL2E: Structure and History of European Languages, and Linguistics and the Gaelic Language (pre-Honours).

item.title: Pilot
item.description: I have been awarded funding from the School of Philosophy, Psychology and Language Sciences Pilot Project Fund to initiate work on a database of Gaelic dialect forms.

item.title: Esohph
item.description: I offered two presentations at the Third Edinburgh Symposium on Historical Phonology: a talk on pre-sonorant voicing and language contact in the fringe session on laryngeal phonology and a poster on the history of Brythonic tense and lax vowels in the main session.

item.title: dias
item.description: I presented some fledgling work on the history of the tense/lax distinction and quality in Brythonic vowels at the New Approaches to Brittonic Historical Linguistics symposium at the Dublin Institute of Advanced Studies. Get the slides and handout here.

item.title: Senior Tutor
item.description: From 1 August 2017 I am the Senior Tutor in the School of Philosophy, Psychology and Language Sciences. Please use ppls.senior.tutor@ed.ac.uk for any queries related to that role.

item.title: tphs paper
item.description: My paper Welsh svarabhakti as stem allomorphy has appeared in Transactions of the Philological Society. Download the draft version here or the official version here.

item.title: 25mfm
item.description: I presented Microvariation in laryngeal realism: Preaspiration in North Germanic at the 25th Manchester Phonology Meeting. Get the slides and handout here.

item.title: phonology paper
item.description: My paper The phonologization of redundancy: Length and quality in Welsh vowels has appeared in the latest issue of Phonology. See the published version here or the author manuscript here.

item.title: book
item.description: My book A substance-free framework for phonology: An analysis of the Breton dialect of Bothoa is now out with Edinburgh University Press. Read more here.

item.title: obo
item.description: My annotated bibliography of works related to Celtic initial consonant mutations has appeared in Oxford Bibliographies Online here. The table of contents is available here

item.title: fino
item.description: I presented Variation in North Germanic preaspiration at the Fonologi i Norden (FiNo) conference at the University of Agder. Download slides and handout

item.title: phonology board
item.description: From January 2017 I am serving on the editorial board of Phonology.

item.title: teachind spring 2017
item.description: In the second semester of 2016⁄2017, I am teaching phonology on LEL2D: Cross-Linguistic Variation: Limits and Theories (I am also the course organizer for this course); Indo-European, Celtic, and phonology on LEL2E: Structure and History of European Languages; a range of topics on Historical Phonology; the entirety of Celtic, English and Norse in Contact; and phonetics, phonology and historical linguistics on Linguistics and the Gaelic Language. My office hours are Tuesday, 13:00–15:00.

item.title: pihph
item.description: We have launched a new journal called Papers in Historical Phonology. Read more about it, and the first articles, here. I have contributed a paper on rule scattering and vowel length in Northern Romance — comments welcome!

item.title: tionol presentation
item.description: We presented new results of the project on Irish short vowels with Máire Ní Chiosáin at Tionól 2016 (slides and handout here) and at Language Documentation and Linguistic Theory 5 (slides and handout here).

item.title: welsh paper
item.description: Two recent manuscripts on Welsh are now listed: one on quantity-quality interactions in Welsh vowels in substance-free phonology (to appear in Phonology) and one on the so-called ‘provection’ of south-eastern Welsh and its relevance for feature theory (to appear in a volume with OUP)

item.title: nrn proceedings
item.description: My paper on tonogenesis in North Germanic has appeared in a volume of proceedings of the Nordic Research Network 2015 conference

item.title: lautgeographie talk
item.description: I presented The northwest European phonological area: New approaches to an old problem at Edinburgh’s local Linguistic Circle. I very much welcome any feedback on this work.

item.title: clc ldlt
item.description: Máire Ní Chiosáin presented our work on vowel backness and consonant palatalization in Irish at the 9th Celtic Linguistics Conference in Cardiff (handout and slides). We will also present related work at Tionól 2016 in Dublin, and Language Documentation and Linguistic Theory 5 in London.

item.title: JCGL paper
item.description: My paper Prosodic structure and suprasegmental features: Short-vowel stød in Danish has appeared in Journal of Comparative Germanic Linguistics. Download the final version here or at the journal’s website.

item.title: book
item.description: My book A substance-free framework for phonology: An analysis of the dialect of Bothoa will appear with Edinburgh University Press in 2017. Read more here

item.title: rnag2016
item.description: Will Lamb presented the results of our joint work on quantitative approaches to dialect variation in Scottish Gaelic morphology at Rannsachadh na Gàidhlig 2016 at Sabhal Mòr Ostaig. Get the slides and handout here

item.title: amc
item.description: I presented, with Remco Knooihuizen, Vowel length in Shetland Norn: Contact, change, and competing systems, at the First AMC Symposium at the University of Edinburgh

item.title: leave
item.description: In the autumn semester of 2016⁄2017, I will be on research leave and will not be teaching any courses. See the teaching page for the spring semester plans.

item.title: ocp13-fisk
item.description: Our joint work with Máire Ní Chiosáin on consonant palatalization and vowel backness in Irish and Scottish Gaelic was presented at the 13th Old World Conference in Phonology in Budapest and Fonologi i Skandinavien (FiSK) meeting in Gothenburg

item.title: carnegie
item.description: I have been awarded a £3,183 Research Incentive Grant by the Carnegie Trust for the Universities of Scotland for the project Preaspiration in North Germanic: Internal variation and language history. Read more here

item.title: Spring 2016 teaching
item.description: In the spring semester of 2015⁄2016, I will be teaching on the following courses: LEL2D: Cross-Linguistic Variation: Limits and Theories (pre-Honours; I am also the course organizer); LEL2E: Structure and History of European Languages (pre-Honours); Linguistics and the Gaelic Language (pre-Honours); Celtic, English, and Norse in Contact (Honours); and Historical Phonology (Honours/MSc).

item.title: cjl
item.description: From 1st January 2016 I have been serving on the editorial board of the Canadian Journal of Linguistics | Revue canadienne de linguistique

item.title: ocp13
item.description: Our joint work with Máire Ní Chiosáin on consonant palatalization and vowel backness in Irish and Scottish Gaelic was presented at the 13th Old World Conference in Phonology in Budapest, and is on the programme for the Fonologi i Skandinavien (FiSK) meeting in Gothenburg

item.title: eshp2
item.description: I presented Phonetic (non-)explanation in historical phonology: Duration, harmony, and dissimilation (with Bert Botma and Hidetoshi Shiraishi) at the 2nd Edinburgh Symposium on Historical Phonology.

item.title: sem1 teaching
item.description: In the autumn semester of 2015⁄2016, I am teaching LASC10088 Phonological Theory. For further teaching plans, see here.

item.title: frlsu
item.description: I presented our joint work on Argyll Gaelic preaspiration with Michael Ramsammy and Patrick Honeybone at the conference of the Forum for Research on the Languages of Scotland and Ulster (University of the West of Scotland, Ayr).

item.title: ahrc
item.description: I have been invited to serve on the AHRC Peer Review College from October 2015 through 2018.

item.title: ICCS
item.description: I presented Pitch accent and preaspiration in Gaelic: Reconsidering contact origins at the 15th International Congress of Celtic Studies at the University of Glasgow, Scotland.

item.title: gregynog
item.description: I presented Free and not so free: Dialect variation and quantity-quality interactions in Welsh vowels at the 22nd Welsh Linguistics Seminar

item.title: Welsh vowels presentation at the mfm
item.description: I presented Quantity-quality interactions in Welsh vowels: Phonologization across dialects at the 23rd Manchester Phonology Meeting.

item.title: nrn
item.description: I presented ‘An echoing tone: Pitch accent parallels in Scandinavia and Scotland’ at the Nordic Research Network conference at the University of Edinburgh. Get the slides and handout.

item.title: ICNGL paper
item.description: My paper ‘Pitch accent’ and prosodic structure in Scottish Gaelic: Reassessing the role of contact has appeared in New trends in Nordic and general linguistics, edited by Martin Hilpert, Janet Duke, Christine Mertzlufft, Jan-Ola Östman, and Michael Rießler (Mouton de Gruyter). Read more and download a copy here.

item.title: RSE grant
item.description: I received a Small Research Grant in the Arts and Humanities from the Royal Society of Edinburgh for the project The phonetics and phonology of short vowels in Irish and Scottish Gaelic, with Máire Ní Chiosáin (University College Dublin).
